body:
```
(No text was entered with this change)
```

Original issue reported on code.google.com by `THC202` on 2015-04-29 14:19:21

Sorry if this is the wrong place to ask - I'm trying to use the ZAP API at the moment, and I'm looking to reduce the amount of "things" that are done during an active scan. My first thought was to pass a policy file in through the API, but based on this issue being open, I assume that's not possible at the moment. Is there a work around I can use in the meantime?

There are various API endpoints within `/ascan/` that support creating and manipulating policies.

http://127.0.0.1:8080/UI/ascan/
```
policies (scanPolicyName policyId ) 	
scanPolicyNames () 
scanners (scanPolicyName policyId ) 

addScanPolicy (scanPolicyName* alertThreshold attackStrength ) 	
disableAllScanners (scanPolicyName ) 	
disableScanners (ids* scanPolicyName ) 	
enableAllScanners (scanPolicyName ) 	
enableScanners (ids* scanPolicyName ) 
removeScanPolicy (scanPolicyName* ) 
```

https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/blob/develop/src/doc/scanners.md
https://github.com/zaproxy/community-scripts/blob/master/standalone/Active%20scan%20rule%20list.js

issue.title: Allow to import a Scan Policy through the API

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change ActiveScanAPI to allow to import a scan policy from the file
system.

Fix #1604 - Import policy file via API

issue.title: Add new API endpoint to release notes

repository.name: zap-core-help
repository.description: The help files for the ZAP core

issue.body:
Change Release 2.7.0 page to add the new API endpoint that allows to
import a scan policy.

Part of zaproxy/zaproxy#1604 - Import policy file via API

body: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
